html.p: All Extreme Search functions may be entered as commands directly within Splunk Search. Commands are executed, where possible, in parallel on the search peers. Results are returned in the same way all other Splunk Search results are returned. It is not necessary to use an external interface. Extreme Search for Splunk includes the commands listed below. Click on any command name to view the help page for that command.

tr.td: Combines multiple Auto Regression algorithms in a weighted fashion to produce a new aggregate regression formula.
Combines multiple correlation algorithms in a weighted fashion to produce a new aggregate correlation formula.
Combines multiple Linear Regression algorithms in a weighted fashion to produce a new aggregate regression formula.
Combines multiple NonLinear Regression algorithms in a weighted fashion to produce a new aggregate regression formula.
Combines multiple Spearman Correlation algorithms in a weighted fashion to produce a new aggregate Spearman Correlation formula.
Applies a formula created via xsPerformAutoRegression (or xsAggreateAutoRegression) against a stream of data.
Applies a formula created via xsPerformLinearRegression (or xsAggregateLinearRegression) against a stream of data.
Applies a formula created via xsPerformNonLinearRegression (or xsAggreateNonLinearRegression) against a stream of data.
Makes a full copy of a Context.
Copies a Concept from one Context to another.
Creates a Concept for an existing Context.
Creates a data driven context, which contains concepts based on a variety of methods of mapping qualitative semantics to the data. Note: This is a Splunk 'streaming' command.
Creates a user defined context, which contains concepts based on a variety of methods of mapping qualitative semantics to the data. This is a Splunk 'generating' command.
Deletes a Concept from a Context.
Takes the lowest and highest x value, applies linear regression to these values, and maps the results to the Concept represented by the Y field.
Displays all of the Concepts in a Context.
Displays one or more Concepts (with hedges).
Displays the (hedged) Concepts used by xsWhere.
Returns the name of the Concept that best fits (highest compatibility) the field, as well as the associated compatibility index (CIX).
Returns the membership value of a data value in each concept in a specified context, or returns the data value given a membership value in a specified context.
Determine the compatibility index for the field in each concept in a context.
Displays the specified fields of a context as a table.

tbody.tr: xsGetDistance Statistical Reasoning Determine the distance (in miles) between two locations. -

tr.td: Generates the compatibility index (cix) of a conceptual query.
List the contexts in private, app or global.
List the concepts from a context in private, app or global.
List the Unit of Measurement (UOM) from a context in private, app or global.
Merge two contexts into a new context.

For each event, lookup the value of a field and calculate the normalized value as a percentage between the domainMin and the domainMax of a context. Used to normalize data across multiple Contexts. Very useful in risk scoring.

Performs linear (least squares) and polynomial (max entropy) regression for a set of data streams. For linear regression, the function y=coef1*x+coef2 is generated for each stream. For polynomial, a three coefficient function, y= coef0*x^2+coef1*x+coef2, is generated for each stream.
Performs correlation of a data stream or compatibility index stream.
Performs linear regression of data streams (x) over other data streams(y). For each pair of data streams, the following function is generated: y=slope*x+intercept
Performs quadratic (non-linear) regression of data streams (x) over other data streams (y). For each pair of data streams, the following function is generated: y=coef0*x^2+coef1*x+coef2.
Performs Spearman correlation of a data stream or compatibility index stream.
Predicts the future values of a time-series data stream.
Sets the value(s) of the specified field(s) of a context.
Updates an existing Concept in an existing Context.
Updates a data-driven context, which contains concepts based on a variety of methods of mapping qualitative semantics to the data. Note: This is a Splunk 'streaming' command.
Updates a user-defined context, which contains concepts based on a variety of methods of mapping qualitative semantics to the data. This is a Splunk 'generating' command.
Selects a collection of rows from the data space based on the application of qualitative semantics (which are created by xsCreateDDContext or xsCreateUDContext).

html.p: Extreme Search includes a number of powerful macros to help you to more easily leverage qualitative expression in Splunk.

tr.td: Uses the value of the "search" field in a context to automatically update the context.
Builds a "by classlist" token if the classlist is not null. Otherwise returns "".
Generates the statistics needed for creation of a data driven context.
Creates a data driven context with a variable set of arguments.
Returns the name of the Concept that best fits (highest compatibility) the field, as well as the associated compatibility index (CIX).

html.p: The following commands are provided by the Extreme Search Visualization app. Like commands provided by Extreme Search, they may be entered as commands directly within Splunk Search. Results are returned within the Splunk web interface. It is not necessary to use an external interface. Click on any command name to view the help page for that command.

tr.td: Creates an Anomaly driven Context containing two Concepts which typically represent Normal and Anomalous. Note: This is a Splunk 'streaming' command.

td.p: Creates a Crossover driven context, which contains Concepts based on a variety of methods of mapping qualitative semantics to the data. Note: This is a Splunk 'streaming' command.

tr.td: Creates a Saved Search in a named app.
Discovers Contexts in the Splunk environment.
Discovers all searches in the Splunk environment, which contain Extreme Search commands.
Redefines the shape of a Concept in a Context and all its classes.
